title: Hunter Valley: Woman injured in hot air balloon accident on public holiday
text:
A woman has been injured following a heavy landing in a hot air balloon.

The woman was flying above Luskintyre Airfield, in the New South Wales Hunter Valley, just before 8am on Monday.

The balloon she was travelling in hit another balloon on the ground at speeds of 40km/h, Nine News reported.

The woman was in a hot air balloon at Luskintyre Airfield, in the New South Wales Hunter Valley, just before 8am on Monday (stock)

A New South Wales Ambulance spokeswoman told Daily Mail Australia the incident was 'more of a heavy landing than a crash'.

The injured woman, believed to be in her 40s, was taken to John Hunter Hospital with pelvic injuries.

She was in a stable condition when taken to the hospital.

A NSW Police spokesman told Daily Mail Australia they were not called to the incident.
